intro: Dillwynia hispidula, commonly known as the hispid dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. It has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Dillwynia hispidula is a perennial shrub that produces pods containing several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
